name: Pears Carrots And Oats Bread Loaf
description: A delicious and healthy pear carrots and oats bread loaf. Great for sandwiches, snacks and toast and very simple to make. Vegan recipe.
recipeIngredient: more water or flour if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the yeast and sugar in 2 tablespoons warm water and keep aside for 10 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the yeast and sugar in 2 tablespoons warm water and keep aside for 10 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Puree the pear and carrots separately. Use some water if required.
recipeInstructions.name: Puree the pear and carrots separately. Use some water if required.

recipeInstructions.text: In the mixer bowl add in all the dry ingredients and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: In the mixer bowl add in all the dry ingredients and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the purees, butter, and yeast mixture and knead in mixer or by hand (total atleast 10 mins) until a soft dough is formed. I kneaded in the mixer 2-3 minutes at a time, to get a nice ball of dough with good gluten development. The dough should be non sticky and soft. The carrots and pear will leak moisture in the dough, so keep it a bit dry and non sticky. Add more water/bread flour if required.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the purees, butter, and yeast mixture and knead in mixer or by hand (total atleast 10 mins) until a soft dough is formed. I kneaded in the mixer 2-3 minutes at a time, to get a nice ball of dough with good gluten development. The dough should be non sticky and soft. The carrots and pear will leak moisture in the dough, so keep it a bit dry and non sticky. Add more water/bread flour if required.

recipeInstructions.text: Place dough in well greased container. Spray dough with cooking oil spray. Cover with plastic wrap and keep in a warm place for an hour.
recipeInstructions.name: Place dough in well greased container. Spray dough with cooking oil spray. Cover with plastic wrap and keep in a warm place for an hour.

recipeInstructions.text: Take dough out, punch it down and knead for a minute. Use a little bread flour if the dough gets sticky.
recipeInstructions.name: Take dough out, punch it down and knead for a minute. Use a little bread flour if the dough gets sticky.

recipeInstructions.text: Using boule technique, pull on all sides and tuck under. Shape into an oblong shape and place loaf with tucked side down, in greased bread pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Using boule technique, pull on all sides and tuck under. Shape into an oblong shape and place loaf with tucked side down, in greased bread pan.

recipeInstructions.text: Spritz top with oil spray. Cover with a kitchen towel and let rise for another 45 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Spritz top with oil spray. Cover with a kitchen towel and let rise for another 45 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Place bread pan in middle rack of pre-heated oven and bake at 380 degrees F for 25 minutes. Rotate bread pan by 180degrees for even bake and bake for another 10-15minutes .
recipeInstructions.name: Place bread pan in middle rack of pre-heated oven and bake at 380 degrees F for 25 minutes. Rotate bread pan by 180degrees for even bake and bake for another 10-15minutes .

recipeInstructions.text: Cool completely on rack before slicing. I usually also put the cooled bread in the fridge for half an hour before slicing. That cools the core and makes it a little stiff and hence easier to slice without squishing.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool completely on rack before slicing. I usually also put the cooled bread in the fridge for half an hour before slicing. That cools the core and makes it a little stiff and hence easier to slice without squishing.

keywords: easy bread recipe, vegan bread recipe, vegetable bread
